pullrequest.title: Final changes to make Atlas v4 & v5 stand and walk

content.raw:
I see error messages similar to Jose's when I run keyboard teleop, but Gazebo also crashes. Specifically, I press "i", see the robot lifting its leg to take a step, gazebo crashes.

```
 [AtlasSimInterface] [Atlas3SimRTInterface] unknown variable specified for ocu_set. name='step.step.delayed_trans_state_d'
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,populate_step_path,198 did not get all the steps I asked for
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Step(0) asked for 5 and got 1
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Path Server: user_path_server
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	Trying to find (     1 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    2 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    3 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    4 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] 	API Queue has  (     0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,185: unknown contact info, could not find step leg
```

The keyboard_teleop python script kept running, though.

On second try, the program did not crash. I didn't see the weird behavior Jose did, but when interrupted walking by pressing "r", it fell over while trying to stop itself. I don't know if this is normal behavior for the keyboard_teleop controller, however.
content.html:
I see error messages similar to Jose's when I run keyboard teleop, but Gazebo also crashes. Specifically, I press "i", see the robot lifting its leg to take a step, gazebo crashes.

 [AtlasSimInterface] [Atlas3SimRTInterface] unknown variable specified for ocu_set. name='step.step.delayed_trans_state_d'
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,populate_step_path,198 did not get all the steps I asked for
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Step(0) asked for 5 and got 1
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Path Server: user_path_server
 [AtlasSimInterface]    Trying to find (     1 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    2 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    3 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    4 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface]    API Queue has  (     0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] ,    0 [AtlasSimInterface] )
 [AtlasSimInterface] Atlas3Step_walk.cpp,185: unknown contact info, could not find step leg

The keyboard_teleop python script kept running, though.

On second try, the program did not crash. I didn't see the weird behavior Jose did, but when interrupted walking by pressing "r", it fell over while trying to stop itself. I don't know if this is normal behavior for the keyboard_teleop controller, however.
